titleStmt.title: A monumentall pyramide to all posterities erected to the euer-liuing memory, and perpetuall honour of the all-vertuous and euer-glorious prince, Lodovvick, late Duke of Richmond and Lenox ... Who departed this transitory life at his chamber in White-Hall, on Monday, being the sixteenth day of February, 1624, betwixt sixe and seauen of the clocke in the morning, to the great griefe of many thousand people of sundry nations.
titleStmt.author: Darcie, Abraham, fl. 1625.

titleStmt.title: A monumentall pyramide to all posterities erected to the euer-liuing memory, and perpetuall honour of the all-vertuous and euer-glorious prince, Lodovvick, late Duke of Richmond and Lenox ... Who departed this transitory life at his chamber in White-Hall, on Monday, being the sixteenth day of February, 1624, betwixt sixe and seauen of the clocke in the morning, to the great griefe of many thousand people of sundry nations.
titleStmt.author: Darcie, Abraham, fl. 1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Edw. All-de [and George Eld] for Nathaniel Butter,

notesStmt.note: "Eld pr[inted]. quire A; Allde app[arently]. the rest"--STC.
The second leaf recto and verso are mourning pages.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
